p: Oregano or marjoram ( Origanum vulgare Linn.) is the most variable species of the genus Origanum, characterized by morphological and chemical diversity. Used worldwide since ancient times in traditional and popular medicine, oregano is spread all over the world and is particularly abundant in the Mediterranean, Eurasian, and North African area. Several studies have shown that the plant has a wide variety of secondary metabolites, most of them phenolic compounds such as flavonoids, terpenoids, phenolic acids and alkaloids, and fatty acids, among others, which are the main components responsible for its action [ 12].
